channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: I don't think everyone realizes how much #neuroscience #opendata is really downloaded and reused...e.g. our dataset of responses to visual stimuli has 18,000 downloads; wholebrain #zebrafish neural activity from the Ahrens lab has 7,000 downloads; Nick Steinmetz's eight-probe Neuropixels data has 6,500 downloads. and there are many commonly used neuro datasets on websites that don't count downloads that must have thousands too!post your data and they will come :) #openscience

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: (was discussing this today with some great NeurodataWithoutBorders #NWB developers and hackers)

item.title: Noelle üìö
item.description: The next date for #JoinMastodonDay has been picked! It's a week from now, on July 30th. July 30th is also the International Day of Friendship which is a perfect day to invite your friends to join Mastodon. As on the previous Join Mastodon Day (which was on March 9th), you can help by spreading the word on any other social media platforms you're on, or by writing a blog post, or by sending out a pigeon! Idk get creative üòÇ I'm excited, let's do this! üòä #mastodon #fediverse #SocialMedia

item.title: Carl T. Bergstrom
item.description: An opioid expert from Texas A&M gave a guest lecture and mentioned that Texas lieutenant governor Dan Patrick‚Äôs policies were costing lives. Within hours, Patrick‚Äôs office got her suspended, formally censured, and nearly fired. https://www.texastribune.org/2023/07/25/texas-a-m-professor-opioids-dan-patrick/

item.title: John Tuthill
item.description: Congratulations to @lili on a superb PhD defense today!Watercolor artwork by @lili's co-advisor Bing Brunton.#neuroscience #phd

item.title: Matt Baggott
item.description: Open access paper on open label pilot study of psilocybin for anorexia "Results suggest that psilocybin therapy is safe, tolerable and acceptable for female AN, which is a promising finding given physiological dangers and problems with treatment engagement."https://www.nature.com/articles/s41591-023-02455-9#psychedelics

item.title: Emma Kennedy
item.description: Again, I am left flabbergasted that one man's beef with his bank has become a matter of national importance. Farage is like the Pied Piper when it comes to the News Cycle. Whistle and they follow.

item.title: Pixels
item.description:
#introduction
Bonjour bonjour. Le but de ce compte est essentiellement de tester le partage automatique des articles propos√©s sur la rubrique Pixels du journal @lemonde. Ceux-ci sont notamment sign√©s de l'√©quipe Pixels (Olivier Clairouin, @CorentinLamy, Pauline Croquet, @DLL, @flrnd, Nicolas Six, Pierre Trouv√© et @martu), de nos pigistes mais aussi d'autres membres de la r√©daction du journal.

item.title: Dr Sarah McIntyre
item.description: New pre-print "Mechanoreceptive AŒ≤ primary afferents discriminate naturalistic social touch inputs at a functionally relevant time scale". I presented this recently at #FestivalofTouch #IASAT #ResearchInTouch. https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.22.549516v1

item.title: Konrad Kording
item.description: Most disagreements on x site are about this

item.title: Tim Hollo
item.description: I'm finding it a little hard to work today with this in my head.Antarctic ice extent is now 6.4 standard deviations below the mean. That is, I'm reliably told, a one in 13 billion year event.We're about to see a lot of shit hit a lot of fans. And we are far from ready.Business as usual is over. Politics as usual is over. We need to be putting our effort into building systems that can help us survive what greed and power and wilful blindness have wrought.#ClimateCrisis #Antarctica

item.title: Jonny
item.description: @computingnature hell ya!!!! i was just checking in on some torrent clients i have seeding some data on academictorrents and several of them had thousands of uploads just from my client - and they weren't even my data! people do really be reusing this data. Now if only we could burn down this publishing system so that labor could be valued how it should be <3

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: One day we're going to have to stop trusting papers from people who have demonstrated their untrustworthiness.https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-02401-2

item.title: Robert Sanscartier
item.description: DETROIT ‚Äì Seven major automakers say they're joining forces to build a North American electric vehicle charging network that would rival Tesla's and nearly double the number of fast-charging plugs in the U.S. and CanadaGeneral Motors, BMW, Honda, Hyundai, Kia, Mercedes and Stellantis said Wednesday that they will share in a multibillion-dollar investment to build ‚Äúhigh power‚Äù charging stations with at least 30,000 plugs in urban areas and along travel corridors by 2030https://www.local10.com/business/2023/07/26/major-automakers-unite-to-build-electric-vehicle-charging-network-they-say-will-rival-teslas/

item.title: David Colquhoun
item.description:
Lord Frost seems to be remarkably ill-informed about climate. Doesn't he know that the most likely outcome is that the gulf stream will switch off, freezing Europe while rest of the world fries?
See video by Stefan Rahmstorf
https://twitter.com/i/status/1684149268855107586
